etymology.description: phonetic: 工(工) (gōng, "work") + semantic: 力(力) (lì, "strength") = work combined with strength -> achievement or skill
etymology.interpretation: The character combines the idea of physical or mental work 工(工) (gōng, "work") with 力(力) (lì, "strength") to convey the concept of successfully applying effort towards an accomplishment.

examples.chinese: 他勤学苦练(他勤學苦練)，练就了一身好功(練就了一身好功)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qín xué kǔ liàn, liàn jiù le yì shēn hǎo gōng.
examples.english: He studied diligently and developed excellent skills.

examples.chinese: 他凭着平时积累的功(他憑著平時積累的功)，创造了惊人的纪录(創造了驚人的紀錄)。
examples.pinyin: Tā píng zhe píng shí jī lěi de gōng, chuàng zào le jīng rén de jì lù.
examples.english: He relied on his accumulated skills to create an astonishing record.
